explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
Traffic Separation Scheme (TSS) compliance; applicable to cargo vessels navigating near major shipping lanes in regulated waters; spatial anchor: Hirtshals - Larvik and Skagen Fiber West corridors
Operational Protocol Rationale: Cargo vessels of this size and draught, operating without hazardous cargo and under way using engine, typically follow straight, predictable paths through designated maritime corridors to comply with traffic separation rules and ensure safe passage among high-density shipping routes. The observed stable speed, consistent heading, and minimal deviation between course over ground and heading reflect autopilot-assisted transit along a fixed route, which is standard practice in open-water segments of regulated lanes. This behavior prioritizes navigational predictability and collision avoidance, distinguishing it from more dynamic maneuvers such as anchoring, port approach, or evasive turns. Although slight curvature may appear in localized segments, the overall kinematic profile—steady motion, linear progression, and temporal consistency—strongly supports sustained transit along a predefined axis rather than free navigation or maneuvering in confined waters.
'''
